text: Do It for Love is the fourth studio album by English recording artist Alesha Dixon. It was released on 9 October 2015 in the United Kingdom by Precious Stone Records. The album's lead single, "The Way We Are" which was co-written by Dixon with Alex James and Harry Sommerdahl and was released digitally on 21 June 2015. The album's second single, 'Tallest Girl' was released on 18 September 2015. Dixon released a remixed version of 'People Need Love' as a charity single on 11 December 2015.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y_ioQMhcEIEhttps://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/people- need-love-ash-howes/id1065923608 ==Background== In January 2012, Dixon released "Do It Our Way (Play)" to complement advertising by weight loss company Weight Watchers. The same year it was confirmed that Dixon would be a judge on Britain's Got Talent. In December 2014 she announced that she would be releasing a new single in either March or May 2015. Do It For Love marks Alesha's first album in five years. In January 2015 she returned for the ninth series of Britain's Got Talent. In March, Dixon confirmed she would be releasing her new single "The Way We Are", via her own record label Precious Stone Records, on 21 June. The first live performance of the single took place on one the Britain's Got Talent live shows in May of that year. It marks Alesha's first single release in over four years, following 2011's "Every Little Part of Me". Dixon premiered album track "Azura" during Graham Norton's BBC Radio 2 show. She also explained that the song "Do It for Love" was the first song she had written for the album and was a song about her love for music. ==Track listing== ;Notes *Credits adapted from album liner notes. ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text- align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2015) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- |- |- |} ==Release history== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col" | Region ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Format ! scope="col" | Label ! scope="col" | Ref. |- |rowspan="2"|United Kingdom | | rowspan="2"| | Precious Stone | |} ==References== Category:2015 albums Category:Alesha Dixon albums
